item.title: Canon has launched FleetnexG, a cloud-based logistics solution designed for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs)
item.description: Canon Singapore has launched FleetnexG, a cloud-based logistics solution providing businesses with real-time delivery tracking and automated scheduling. Designed for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) that rely on scheduling, delivery, and documentation for their core operations, FleetnexG offers a way to optimize resources and boost efficiency. Vincent Low, Director & General Manager of Business Imaging Solutions at Canon Singapore, highlights the need for SMEs to go beyond timely order fulfillment. He emphasizes that optimizing resources for greater efficiency and productivity is crucial for success in today’s business landscape.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in Singapore are increasingly transitioning to cloud services
item.description: Parallels, a company specializing in hosting and cloud services, has released an updated report on the Singaporean cloud market for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), called Parallels SMB Cloud Insights. This 2014 report predicts significant growth for the SMB cloud services market in Singapore, projecting it to reach S$916 million by 2017. This represents a strong three-year compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 21%. Source: Parallels. Zanni. John Zanni, Chief Marketing Officer for Service Providers at Parallels, observed that the Asia Pacific region is poised to outpace the rest of the world in cloud adoption due to its later start.

item.title: The Pro Series from HP is effective for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description: HP has introduced a new line of Pro Series desktops, notebooks, and an all-in-one (AiO) PC tailored for businesses of all sizes, particularly small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Serena Yong, Managing Director of HP Singapore, highlighted the challenges faced by businesses in making technology decisions with limited budgets and IT resources. She emphasized that the HP BusinessNow program aims to provide support and access to solutions like the HP Pro Series.

item.title: ASEAN releases strategic plan for the development of small and medium enterprises
item.description: Source: ASEAN Secretariat. The ASEAN Strategic Action Plan for SME Development (SAPSMED) 2016-2025 acknowledges the significant role of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in ASEAN’s economic growth, job creation, and women’s empowerment. The plan seeks to enhance MSME participation in an increasingly competitive market and support their expansion and progress. This plan outlines an implementation roadmap utilizing country representatives, leveraging available resources, including those from ASEAN Dialogue Partners, and incorporating regular monitoring and evaluation.

item.title: India will receive the India Inclusive Innovation Fund
item.description: The Indian Cabinet has approved a proposal from the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) to establish a dedicated fund. This fund will focus on promoting grassroots innovations that generate social benefits alongside reasonable economic returns. Union Minister Shri Kalraj Mishra shared this information in a written response to a question in Lok Sabha. The fund, named “India Inclusive Innovation Fund,” aims to support businesses developing solutions for citizens at the lower end of India’s economic spectrum.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in the Asia-Pacific region are feeling positive about their recovery following the COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: A recent HP study titled “Survival to Revival” surveyed small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) in the Asia-Pacific region and found that over half believe they will not only survive the pandemic but thrive in its aftermath. Digital transformation is considered a key factor in this recovery. The study revealed that 60% of respondents view digital transformation as crucial, particularly in areas like innovative work processes, flexible work arrangements, and tailored products and services.

item.title: Protect your Office 365 emails with the latest Dropsuite cloud solution
item.description: Smaller businesses can access Dropsuite’s email backup and archiving tool for Microsoft Office 365 through intermediary companies like Ozhosting in Australia and ICONZ-Webvisions in Singapore. Dropsuite’s CEO, Charif Elansari, emphasized their commitment to developing user-friendly solutions that are easy for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to buy and use. Ozhosting CEO, Doug Endersbee, expressed satisfaction in offering Dropsuite’s comprehensive email archiving service, which meets legal requirements for retaining records, to their customers.

item.title: Cafédirect introduces new Medium Roast Freeze-Dried instant coffee
item.description: Source: Cafédirect. Cafédirect, a British beverage company, has introduced a new premium instant coffee in Singapore. This medium roast, freeze-dried coffee offers a convenient solution for those seeking a flavorful cup on the go, featuring a smooth, vibrant taste with hints of caramel. Interestingly, a growing number of Singaporean coffee drinkers who typically prefer milk in their coffee are developing a taste for black coffee. This shift is attributed to Cafédirect’s master blender, who has crafted a unique blend using sweet and chocolatey Arabica beans from South America, well-rounded beans from Central America, and robust Robusta beans from East Africa (60%).

item.title: Visa introduces Visa Business Hub to assist small and medium-sized businesses with technology and strategic planning
item.description: Visa has launched the Visa Business Hub, a platform designed to assist small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) in navigating technology and improving their management practices. The hub, initially launched in Singapore and Malaysia, offers software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions that can potentially reduce IT costs by up to 25% through a pay-as-you-use model. This approach minimizes upfront expenses and implementation time. Research indicates that a significant number of businesses in Singapore (80%) view SaaS/cloud adoption as a strategic move rather than a passing trend.

item.title: SMBs can access Office 365 through GoDaddy
item.description: GoDaddy, a technology company that supports small businesses, has partnered with Microsoft to offer Microsoft Office 365 to small businesses in Asian markets. This collaboration is part of GoDaddy’s ongoing effort to provide top-tier business management solutions worldwide. By offering Office 365, GoDaddy allows its customers to easily access professional email linked to a domain name, secure cloud storage, and a wide range of productivity and collaboration tools. “GoDaddy’s understanding of small businesses combined with Microsoft’s email and productivity suite gives small business owners in Asia the tools they need to simplify their operations,” said Roger Chen, Vice President of Asia, GoDaddy.

item.title: The enhanced Alcatel-Lucent OpenTouch Suite for SMB from ALE simplifies collaboration and boosts productivity
item.description: Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise, operating under the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise brand, helps small and medium businesses provide a streamlined user experience and enhanced onsite mobility for their employees, while ensuring business continuity. This is achieved through the latest update of their product, Alcatel-Lucent OpenTouch Suite for SMB. The latest improvements to OpenTouch Suite for SMB focus on increasing productivity and efficiency. This is achieved through expanded communication and collaborative tools, as well as enabling employees to access the company environment from any location, at any time, using mobile applications.

item.title: Big companies are scaling back, while small businesses remain optimistic for 2016 in China
item.description: At the start of 2016, business sentiment in China presents a mixed picture. While confidence among large companies has slightly declined, smaller businesses are expressing optimism, according to separate reports from MNI Indicators and CPA Australia. The MNI China Business Sentiment Indicator dipped to 52.3 in January, down from 52.7 in December. Although this still indicates expansion for the second consecutive month, it marks the first month-over-month decrease since November. Businesses have also tempered their future expectations, as reflected in the Future Expectations Indicator’s 0.

item.title: A Singaporean financial technology company is striving to provide improved lending terms for business-to-business transactions
item.description: A Singapore-based fintech startup, Cash-IN-Asia, has introduced a new business-to-business (B2B) lending platform. The company’s fully digital approach lets business owners secure financing directly from their mobile devices. Cash-IN-Asia aims to support micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in Singapore. The company offers products designed to meet current needs and help these businesses thrive even after the current economic challenges. Their ISO27001-certified platform leverages artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics to deliver a comprehensive solution for MSMEs seeking transparent and flexible financing.

item.title: Kaspersky provides solutions to combat ransomware
item.description: Ransomware is increasingly targeting businesses, encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption keys. A Kaspersky Lab report reveals a six-fold increase in ransomware attacks against businesses from 2015 to 2016, affecting one in ten business users. Cybercriminals are focusing on businesses, particularly small and medium-sized companies. A Kaspersky Lab and B2B International study found that 42% of respondents from these businesses considered ransomware a major threat. Even brief data unavailability can severely impact small businesses, potentially halting operations entirely.
